name: MAKE A PUPPET MASK: Tuesday 1st October,  Wednesday 2nd October                     11am -1pm
description:
Design and construct a mask thats cover your whole head (and some of your body). 
Use simple papier mache and cardboard cutting and folding techniques to construct the most outrageous or the most detailed designs. 
Incorporated movings parts if you like mouths that open and close, or eyes that look around. 
All materials included.

name: MAKE A FAMILY WALL THEATRE: Monday 30th September      11am - 3pm (with a 1 hour break for lunch)
description:
Create a colorful wood and plaster theatre populated with fantastic representations of family members or friends, to hang on the wall at home. 
Students will learn to make basic armatures out of everyday materials, how to imagine and reinterpret family members through sculpture, and techniques for painting their characters for a polished final artwork. 
All materials included.

name: WEAVE A POP UP CONE PUPPET: Tuesday 24th September         11am- 4pm
description:
Combine hand-collected native grasses with threads, materials and silks to form a gorgeous cone basket with a pop up fabric puppet. 
In this workshop become a Master of basketry as Adrienne guides you though the technique of coiling Baskets. Adrienne has lived in the Northern Territory 15 years and has a vast knowledge of Native Plant collecting and processing. 
Come and learn what plants you can use from your own neighborhood.

All materials included.-

name: MAKE A SHORT FILM: Sunday 22 and Monday 23 from 10 am to 3 pm.
description:
Participants will develop and apply the skills necessary to write and produce a short film.

In this hands on class, participants will be taught the stages 
required to produce a film. They will learn writing techniques, story structure, how to format a script and develop a strong narrative and interesting characters to create an original screenplay. 

The workshop will cover aspects of pre-production and production. 
Each participant will have an experience as Camera Operator, Sound Operator, Stand-by props, Stand-by costume and on the Clapper Board. Students will work in collaboration to produce a film, assuming roles as Actors or that of Director, Production Designer or Producer.

Participants will be given a final copy of the edited and completed film. 
All materials included.-

name: PUPPETRY, WORKING WITH LATEX:   Sundays 1 pm - 5 pm.       Starting November 3th
description:
Latex is a wonderful material for creating puppets.  It is flexible and a great deal of detail can be achieved.   During this 5 week workshop you will learn the basic techniques of modelling in clay, casting in plaster and then learn the techniques of using latex and how to paint it.
Your finished puppet will have a latex head and hands and a body sculpted from foam rubber.
All materials included.

name: CHARACTER CREATION AND DEVELOPMENT:    Mondays 6:30 to 8:30 pm.   Beginning  October 7th
description:
Award-Winning Australian Director Lucien Simon will be running a Master Class on his unique character creation and development process. 

For the feature-length film Breeding in Captivity, currently in post-production, Lucien Simon developed a unique collaborative scriptwriting process inspired by the work of Academy Award winning Director/Writer Mike Leigh.  The main point of differentiation between Mike Leigh’s method and Lucien’s process is the way in which Lucien works with the actors to build their characters. 

The character development process involves visualization techniques to physicalize the character. Once the physical form is defined, the actor then builds a memory map that is, in turn, connected to the physicality of the character. Not only does the actor build a unique physical presence but the actor also creates a defined history that is linked to the physical body thus causing the actor, when at risk, to have spontaneous physical and memory reactions when performing.
   
Master-Class participants will develop a unique character as well as improvise and devise scenes using that character.

SUITABLE FOR:  
These Master Classes are for Actors, Directors & Writers interested in learning this character development process.

name: WEAVING.  POP UP CONE PUPPETS:          Tuesdays  6:30 - 8:30 pm         Starting October 8th
description:
Combine hand-collected native grasses with threads, materials and silks to form a gorgeous cone basket with a  pop up fabric puppet.   
In this workshop become a Master of basketry as Adrienne guides you though the technique of coiling Baskets. Adrienne has lived in the Northern Territory 15 years and has a vast knowledge of Native Plant collecting and processing.  
Come and learn what plants you can use from your own neighborhood.

All materials included.-

name: DRAWING PORTRAITURE:     Wednesdays 6:30- 8:30 pm.
description:
Enchanting artist Lucy Hardie reveals her techniques using micro-ink and graphite to enable you to create a portrait which integrates reality and its shadow. Students will learn to incorporate imaginary and symbolic visual elements with hyperrealism, to communicate a message about the person or subject matter that they are representing.  
All materials included.

name: SHADOW PUPPETRY FOR THEATRE AND FILM:    Thursdays 6:30 -8:30 pm.         Starting October 3th
description:
Shadow Theatre is so expressive because we are drawn to the essence of the character. We lose a lot of visual noise and can concentrate on the moving shadow figures. Even in these days of sophisticated animation and access to computer technology, shadow theatre continues to mesmerise.
				
Over 3 weekly sessions, master puppeteer Sue Wallace will teach students to create a number of shadow images with moving parts. Techniques include designing for shadow theatre, developing mechanisms, experimenting with light and developing a narrative for shadow theatre. Students will present a shadow theatre piece.

During the following 4 weeks, animator and interactive multi media artist Christie Widarsito will guide students through the process necessary to turn their shadow puppets into a short animated film with music.

The group will devise and present one or a number of short shadow pieces. Each student will take home the shadow puppets they have made as well as a DVD copy of their short film.

All materials included.

name: THE NEVILLE WORKSHOP:      Fridays   6.30 - 8.30 pm.    Beginning November 1th
description:
Inspired by the work of the great Australian/Dutch puppeteer Neville Tranter, the Neville workshop is an intensive puppet building and manipulation workshop for adults. With paper, cardboard, foam, fabric and paint each participant will create their own extraordinary hand puppet. After the making comes the manipulation, learning the techniques of lip-sync and eye- line to support the character development that leads to the living puppet. 
All materials included.

name: LIFE DRAWING SESSIONS:     Thursdays 6:30- 8:30 pm        Starting November 21th.
description:
Join us for fun evenings of life drawings.  
Surprise themes and poses will be accompanied by music and personal guidance by artist Gonzalo Varela.

Every session will include experimentation with new materials and technical instruction.

Explore anatomy trough light and shade, tone, volume.

2 Hour sesións every week.
$ 25 Cost includes all materials.

name: FILMAKING:        Mondays 4:30 to 6:00 pm         Starting October 7th
description:
Participants will develop and apply the skills necessary to write and produce a short film.

In this hands on class, participants will be taught the stages
required to produce a film. They will learn writing techniques, story structure, how to format a script and develop a strong narrative and interesting characters to create an original screenplay.
 
The workshop will cover aspects of pre-production and production.  
Each participant will have an experience as Camera Operator, Sound Operator, Stand-by props, Stand-by costume and on the Clapper Board. Students will work in collaboration to produce a film, assuming roles as Actors or that of Director, Production Designer or Producer. 

Participants will be given a final copy of the edited and completed film.
All materials included.-

name: BIRD HEAD MASK PUPPETS:   Tuesdays  4:00 to 6:00 pm.      Starting  October 22th.
description:
Design and construct a mask thats cover your whole head (and some of your body).
Use simple papier mache and cardboard cutting and folding techniques to construct the most outrageous or the most detailed designs.
Incorporated movings parts if you like mouths that open and close, or eyes that look around.
All materials included.

name: MAKE A WALL THEATRE:        Wednesdays   4:30 pm to 6:00 pm.         Starting October 3th
description:
Create a colorful wood and plaster theatre  populated  with fantastic representations of family members or friends, to hang on  the  wall  at  home. 
Students  will learn  to  make  basic armatures out of everyday materials, how to imagine and reinterpret family members  through  sculpture,  and techniques for painting their characters for  a  polished  final  artwork.
All materials included.

name: SHADOW PUPPET ANIMATION:     Thursdays from 4.30- 6pm.       Starting October 3th.
description:
Students will create their own shadow puppet  film,  learning  to make articulated shadow puppets for film, stop animation techniques, how to develop a  narrative and apply sound to their film.  

The  workshop  will  culminate  in a showing of their film, an event which parents  and  friends  are  welcome  to attend.
All materials included.

name: MAKE A LITTLE MONSTER:       Wednesdays 4:30 to 6:00 pm        Starting  November 6th.
description:
Using a variety of recycled jumpers and assorted fa bric, participants will create a ‘Little Monster’ of their very own. 
They will learn hand sewing and embellishing techniques with a wide variety of buttons, trims and fabrics at their disposition for inspiration.

All materials included.

name: THE NEVILLE WORKSHOP FOR TEENAGERS:        Fridays 4:30 -6:00 pm.         Beginning November 1th.
description:
Inspired by the work of the great Australian/Dutch puppeteer Neville Tranter, the Neville workshop is an intensive puppet building and manipulation workshop for teenagers over 14 years. With paper, cardboard, foam, fabric and paint each participant will create their own extraordinary hand puppet. After the making comes the manipulation, learning the techniques of lip-sync and eye- line to support the character development that leads to the living puppet
All materials included.
